data.text:
Mission

The Madison Regional Health Foundation exists to support the Madison Regional Health System and the healthcare needs of the greater Madison community. The Foundation will seek donations and raise funds for capital improvements, enhancements to patient care, technology upgrades, and otherwise fulfill Madison Regional Health System’s commitment to provide quality healthcare close to home.

Vision

The Madison Regional Health Foundation aspires to provide resources to assist the Madison Regional Health System in identifying and meeting the ever-changing health care needs of the communities we serve for the present and future years to come.

Goals

Madison Regional Health Foundation’s primary goals are to inspire philanthropy and raise funds that will ensure the Madison community has quality healthcare close to home.

Our goals are to grow our endowment to $5 million, double our yearly donors, and extend our services to neighboring communities.

Madison Voelker of Colman was chosen by members of the Madison Regional Health Foundation Scholarship Committee and MRHF Board of Directors to receive The 2023-2024 Doris Garwood Pharmacy Scholarship. Madison will receive $1,000 this school year to help with her education as she is currently in her fourth year at South Dakota State University and her P3 year in pharmacy school. Members of the scholarship committee include Marlin Brozik, Darrel Simon, and Rachel Schardin. “Madison is an amazing student and a great person.” Said Stephen Klekas, MRHF Director. “She has worked just as hard as anyone, has earned a 3.6 GPA, and is involved in many clubs as well.”

The Doris Garwood Pharmacy Scholarship is $1,000 awarded annually to a student that has graduated high school from a city/town within a 30-mile radius of Madison, has completed at least two years of college, and is currently enrolled/accepted to a pharmacy program. The scholarship was set up by Wendell Garwood to honor the memory of his wife, Doris, who passed away in 1988. Originally presented through the Madison Hospital Auxiliary, this scholarship has been awarded annually since 1989 and has helped many pharmacy students complete their education. Madison Regional Health Foundation Scholarship Committee members Marlin Brozik, Darrel Simon, and Rachel Schardin are excited for Madison and the future of pharmacy in the Madison area. “Being able to help young students, like Madison, from our community is what helps make the Foundation and this scholarship special.”

The Colman native has been involved in pharmacy from a young age through a family friend, and eventually started working at a pharmacy through high school. Madison as worked rotations at Madison Regional Health System, Lewis, and at Hy-Vee in Sioux Falls. While at SDSU, Madison is involved with Students Collab. for the Advancement and Promotion of Pharmacy (SCAPP), and also runs clinics and booths at the state fair. After graduation in a couple years, Madison hopes to find a clinic pharmacy job at Lewis.
